always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan with the `submit_day_plan` function for each day of the trip!

name: root
engine_repr:

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"

msg.content: Can you help craft a 5-day travel plan that starts in Colorado Springs and takes in 2 cities in Illinois from March 5th to March 9th, 2022? Single traveler with an overall budget of $1,900.
Can you help craft a 5-day travel plan that starts in Colorado Springs and takes in 2 cities in Illinois from March 5th to March 9th, 2022? Single traveler with an overall budget of $1,900.

Sure! There are lots of great destinations in Illinois. Here's a 5-day trip starting in Colorado Springs and visiting two Illinois cities. I've tried to give you a range of options in each location, although you can adjust this plan to suit your preferences.

## Day 1: Colorado Springs
- Morning: Arrive in Colorado Springs. Check into your accommodation (est. cost: $150).
- Lunch: Explore the downtown area and visit local restaurants for some delicious Colorado cuisine. Try the Front Range BBQ for some slow-smoked meats and local craft beers (est. cost: $20).
- Afternoon: Take a tour of the United States Air Force Academy (est. cost: $15). This is a great introduction to the city's rich military history.
- Evening: Head to Garden of the Gods Park for a sunset hike. This iconic park offers stunning red rock formations and beautiful views (free).
- Dinner: Enjoy dinner at the Rabbit Hole, a unique restaurant with a playful atmosphere and creative dishes (est. cost: $40).

## Day 2: Travel to Chicago, Illinois
- Morning: Grab breakfast at a local Colorado Springs café, like The Principal's Office (est. cost: $15).
- Mid-Morning: Begin your journey to Chicago. The drive will take around 14 hours, so consider renting a car (est. cost: $80-120 per day). You can also take a bus (est. cost: $100 one-way) or fly (est. cost: $150+ for a one-way flight). Adjust your itinerary timings accordingly.
- Afternoon/Evening: Arrive in Chicago and settle into your accommodation (est. cost: $120-200 per night). Explore the vibrant Magnificent Mile area for shopping and dining options.
- Dinner: Try deep-dish pizza, a Chicago specialty, at a renowned pizzeria like Lou Malnati's or Giordano's (est. cost: $20-30).

## Day 3: Exploring Chicago
- Morning: Visit Millennium Park and take in the iconic Cloud Gate sculpture and the beautiful Lurie Garden (free).
- Lunch: Grab a bite at a local restaurant in the Loop, such as the Italian Village for classic Italian cuisine (est. cost: $30-50).
- Afternoon: Explore the Art Institute of Chicago, one of the world's top art museums (est. cost: $25).
- Evening: Catch a show at the iconic Chicago Theatre. Check their website for the latest performances ($50-200+). Alternatively, enjoy a river cruise along the Chicago River ($30-50).

## Day 4: Travel to Moline, Illinois
- Morning: Start your day with a Chicago-style breakfast at Yolk or Chicago Bagel Authority (est. cost: $15-20).
- Mid-Morning: Depart for Moline, a scenic drive of around 165 miles (approx. 3 hours). You can also take a train (est. cost: $50 one-way) or fly (est. cost: $150+ one-way).
- Afternoon: Upon arrival, visit the John Deere Pavilion, celebrating the history of the iconic tractor brand (free).
- Evening: Have dinner at The 11th Street Precinct Bar & Grill, known for its extensive menu and friendly atmosphere (est. cost: $30-50).
- Night: Check out the local nightlife at bars like Bass Street Lounge or The River Room (drinks approx. $5-10 each).

## Day 5: Moline and Return to Colorado Springs
- Morning: Visit the Quad City Botanical Center, offering beautiful gardens and seasonal exhibits (est. cost: $8).
- Lunch: Grab a bite at Lagomarcino's, a local institution known for its chocolates and old-fashioned soda fountain (est. cost: $20-30).
- Afternoon: Take a stroll along the Mississippi Riverwalk, a scenic pathway along the river (free).
- Mid-Afternoon: Begin your journey back to Colorado Springs. The drive will take around 14-16 hours, or you can fly (est. cost: $200+ one-way).
- Evening: Depending on your travel time, enjoy dinner in Colorado Springs or opt for snacks on the go.

Please note that these estimated costs are subject to change and should be used as a guide. I've not included all transportation and accommodation costs in the total, as these can vary greatly based on your preferences and travel arrangements.

submit_day_plan(1, "Colorado Springs", "$1,900", ["Arrive and explore Colorado Springs", "United States Air Force Academy tour", "Garden of the Gods Park hike", "Dinner at The Rabbit Hole"])
submit_day_plan(2, "Chicago", "$1,900", ["Travel to Chicago", "Explore Magnificent Mile", "Try Chicago-style deep-dish pizza"])
submit_day_plan(3, "Chicago", "$1,900", ["Millennium Park and Cloud Gate", "Art Institute of Chicago", "Evening show at Chicago Theatre or river cruise"])
submit_day_plan(4, "Moline", "$1,900", ["Travel to Moline", "John Deere Pavilion", "Dinner at 11th Street Precinct Bar & Grill", "Moline nightlife"])
submit_day_plan(5, "Moline", "$1,900", ["Quad City Botanical Center", "Lunch at Lagomarcino's", "Mississippi Riverwalk stroll", "Return to Colorado Springs"])
